titlestmt.titleproper: Fitchburg, Mass. Calvinistic Congregational Church records, 1805-2006.
titlestmt.author: Zachary Bodnar

did.unittitle: Fitchburg, Mass. Calvinistic Congregational Church records, 1805-2006.
did.abstract: The Calvinistic Congregational Church of Fitchburg, Massachusetts, was formally gathered as the Calvinistic Congregational Society on June 14, 1805. The first meeting house was built in 1806, the second in 1845, and the third, now listed on the National Register of Historic Places, in 1897. The church joined the United Church of Christ in 1961. In 1967, the church joined with the First Methodist Church of Fitchburg to form the Faith United Parish. This collection documents the history and activities of the parish and its members. The records contain committee reports, meeting minutes, vital statistics, financial records, photographic materials, weekly church bulletins, and extensive records kept by various church societies.

corpname.part: Sabbath School Society of Fitchburg. Library

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is unrestricted and open to the public.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Items in this collection are subject to U.S. Copyright Law. It is the responsibility of the researcher to determine the copyright status of collection items and to secure any permissions necessary for their reproduction and publication. Requests for permission to publish material must be discussed with the archivist or librarian.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], in the Fitchburg, Mass. Calvinistic Congregational Church records, 1805-2006, RG5368. The Congregational Library & Archives, Boston, MA.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Materials were gifted to the Congregational Library & Archives, March 2018, by Rev. Jeffrey Conlon; Accession 2018-08.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Prcoessed by Zachary Bodnar, May 2018, using DACS Second Edition.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The Calvinistic Congregational Church of Fitchburg, Massachusetts, was formally gathered as the Calvinistic Congregational Society on June 14, 1805. The church formed during a period of religious tumult within the town of Fitchburg, and within New England in general. Doctrinal disagreements within the First Parish of Fitchburg between Unitarian and Trinitarian congregants came to a head in 1802 with the majority of the more traditionally minded congregants withdrawing from the First Parish. Those that withdrew did so with the intention to form a new religious society. They formed as the Calvinistic Congregational Church three years later. The first meeting house of the Calvinistic Congregational Church was built in 1806 at the corner of Main Street and Rollstone Street. That meeting house was replaced in 1845. The second meeting house was built to accommodate a growing parish; eventually the building was adjoined with a chapel. In 1897, the third and final meeting house was built on the same plot of land. Designed by Henry M. Francis, the third church building is an example of Richardsonian Romanesque architecture and was added to the National Register of Historic Places in 1979. The meeting house's most prominent features were a clock tower and the 20 foot diameter "rose window," which was a stained glass window depicting the angelic choir.

The same kinds of doctrinal disagreements that had resulted in the formation of the Calvinistic Congregational Church from the First Parish of Fitchburg resulted in the formation of a number of other protestant denominations from the Calvinistic Church during the nineteenth-century. The Methodist, Episcopal, and Baptists churches of Fitchburg formed from doctrinal splits within the Calvinistic Church. The Trinitarian Congregational Church split from the Calvinistic Church in 1843 following three tumultuous years of discussions about slavery; its members withdrew from the Calvinistic Church shortly before the Calvinistic Church formally adopted a resolution condemning slavery as an "evil of great magnitude." By 1867 the population in eastern portion of Fitchburg had grown significantly and those members wished to worship in a church more convenient to them; in 1868 those members formed the Rollstone Congregational Church. The Trinitarian Church eventually merged with the Rollstone Congregational Church around 1870.

In 1961, the Calvinistic Congregational Church voted to join with the United Church of Christ. Beginning in 1966, the Calvinistic Church reached out to the other parishes that had formed from it to begin talks of creating a "cooperative parish." The First Methodist Church responded, and in 1967 the Faith United Parish was formed by the two churches. Both churches continued to hold separate finances, polity, and membership, but held joint worship and shared programs and clubs. Both churches stayed united until 2018 when both churches, and Faith United Parish, were formally dissolved.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Fitchburg, Mass. Calvinistic Congregational Church records document the history and activities of parish and its members. This collection contains church and society records, including committee reports, meeting minutes, vital membership records, and church correspondence. Also included are financial records, photographic materials, weekly church bulletins, event calendars, and extensive records kept by various church societies and clubs, including the records of the Fitchburg Sunday School.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection has been divided into five series, with two of those series further divided into subseries. Materials have been arranged in chronological order. Materials closely related by topic have been grouped together when appropriate. When possible, the original order of materials within folders has been maintained.
Subseries 1: Sunday School Society of Fitchburg, 1825-1976.
Subseries 5: Kings Daughters of the C. C. Church, 1888-1967.
Subseries 6: United Workers of the C. C. Church, 1891-1957.
Subseries 7: Fraternal Brotherhood of the C. C. Church, 1910-1942.
Subseries 10: Hisanhern Club of the C. C. Church, 1941-1995.
Subseries 11: Woman's Guild of the C. C. Church, 1953-1970.
Subseries 12: Aims, Ambitions, Ideals Service Club of the Calvinistic Congregational Church, 1953-1970.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Materials from the First Methodist Church of Fitchburg, Mass. were gifted to the School of Theology Library at Boston University in 2018.

corpname.part: Hampton Normal Agricultural Institute (Va.) -- Records and correspondence.
Sabbath School Society of Fitchburg. Library

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains the official records of the Calvinistic Congregational Church and Society. Included in the records are church registers and ledgers, meeting minutes and committee reports, vital statistics, membership lists, church correspondence, and documents related to the church's history and anniversary celebrations.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains the official records of the Calvinistic Church and Society. Primarily the series contains record books and ledgers which include meeting minutes, record of votes, and other official church documents, such as copies of the church constitution and by-laws. Also included with the church record books are supplementary church records, such as officer retreat and clerk records, records and floor plans of the 1954 renovation, year book reports, and various iterations of church handbooks.

did.unittitle: Record of votes on the UCC merger
Church status reports and minister search

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains the vital records of the Calvinistic Congregational Church. Included are birth records, marriage records, records of deaths, baptismal records, admissions, dismissions, and membership lists.

did.unittitle: Membership and Dr. Hugh Penny vital records

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains the minutes, reports, and records of the various church committees that were involved in the governance and management of the Calvinistic Congregational Church.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains records related to the history of the church and the publications produced during church anniversaries.

did.unittitle: History of the Calvinistic Congregational Church of Fitchburg Mass

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains the annual reports produced and complied by the Calvinistic Congregational Church.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains a record of the official communications and correspondence of the church. Included in this subseries are internal communication, such as committee correspondence, and external communications, such as correspondence with active and inactive church members. Also included are letters of resignation.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains the financial records of the Calvinistic Congregational Church. Included in the records are valuations, tax bills, receipts, the treasurer's ledgers, records of gifts and pledges, and pew deed books.

did.unittitle: Calvinistic Congregational Society book of orders

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains the records of various church societies, organizations, and clubs that run beneath the umbrella of the Calvinistic Congregational Church, and later the Faith United Parish. Especially prominent are the records of women's benevolent groups and the Sunday School Society of Fitchburg.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains the records of the Sunday School Society. Included in the records are meeting minutes, annual reports, financial records, and correspondence with outside colleges.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains the record books of the women's Sewing Society.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains the records of the Young People's Society, including minutes, membership lists, and multiple versions of the constitution.

did.unittitle: Young People's Society constituion, members, and committees
Young People's Society constitution and members
Young People's Society constitution and members

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains the manual of the Fitchburg Congregational Club.

did.unittitle: Kings Daughters of the Calvinistic Congregational Church

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains the records of the Kings Daughters of the C. C. Church including record books, ledgers, the constitution, receipts, membership lists and due collections, and clippings. Also included are some materials from the Rollstone Congregational Church's branch of the King's Daughters.

did.unittitle: Rollstone Circle of King's Daughters records
Rollstone Circle of King's Daughters records and historical sketchs
United Workers of the Calvinistic Congregational Church

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains the record books of the United Worker's Guild of the C. C. Church, which include minutes, financial records, event programs, and documents about the history of the society.

did.unittitle: United Workers receipts and treasurer's reports
Fraternal Brotherhood of the Calvinistic Congregational Church

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains the records of the Men's Club, including record books, event details, the society's constitution, and society communications and correspondence.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains the programs and concert details produced by the Choral Society.

scopecontent.p: The programs for the years 1923 and 1924 are not present in the collection.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries includes the yearly event calendars produced by the Fitchburg Woman's Club. There are small gaps present in the collection.

scopecontent.p: This subseries contains the records of the Woman's Guild of the C. C. Church, including record books, event calendars, correspondence, the society's constitution, member lists, and personnel files.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains the record books of COMETS, a joint Congregational and Methodist club formed after the formation of the Faith United Parish.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains published bulletins, magazines, event calendars, and weekly worship programs for the Calvinistic Congregational Church.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Materials
separatedmaterial.p: These attendence records were originally attatched to the weekly bulletins, but became detached and orphaned before the collection's accession.

did.unittitle: The Weekly Reminder / The Mission vol. 3
The Mission / The Mission News vol. 4

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains graphic materials related to the Calvinistic Congregational Church. The mediums covered include photographs, slide negatives, print negatives, and lithographs. Subject matters covered include portraits, photographs of gatherings, and photographic materials related to the restoration of the church.
